author: Staff Reporter
text:
Creative talents of students pursuing education at St. Thomas Matriculation Higher Secondary School in Thoothukudi were revealed through paintings and drawings at the ‘Art and Craft’ exhibition here on Monday.

Though scores of paintings done by the students were displayed, a piece of painting depicting soldiers braving cold wind in the Siachen glacier and sacrificing their lives during a battle against enemies on war captivated the visitors.

Moreover, paintings, which pictured with the concept of ‘Clean My India’ under Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s initiative of ‘Swachh Bharat’ scheme, purely on salt, and the concept of ‘Smart City’ status bestowed on Thoothukudi also hogged the limelight at the show.

The creativity of budding students at the school was brought to the fore in the art of painting 3 D pictures, pot painting, fabric painting, shadow painting, glass painting, canvas painting and paintings were also made on plywood and thermocol.

A. Francis, Principal, told The Hindu that students nowadays were creative, focused and passionate about fashion and design. He said mere academic exercise would not be sufficient in the present scenario, but the creativity talents hidden in students should also be brought out. Rev. Fr.Julians Marlan, Correspondent, said students should be exposed to all forms art. M. Pandeswari, drawing master, said thousand paintings with 32 models were displayed.
title: Students’ creative talents come to fore
